ground_truth: David sits up and puts his head on one side quizzically, turns to see the weights on the ends of the bar, and Joseph walks up to him. David twists around to look at the other end of the bar while Joseph watches tensely. Joseph takes several paces back towards an open covered door. On the bench, David grips his hands out wider than his shoulders and takes the weight, drops the bar slowly to his chest, and pushes up until his arms are straight. He lowers the bar again and straightens his arms, while Joseph stares. Finally, David drops the bar back onto the supports. David's hands wrap around the bar slowly feeling for the optimum grip since even more weights have been clamped to the bar this time. David is frowning slightly, and Joseph stands in the cupboard. On his bench, David braces himself and lowers the bar to his chest. Arms quivering, eyes tight shut, face twisted, he presses it up to full extension, repeats the press, and replaces the bar. Above the bar, Joseph's white face appears upside down to David, standing two steps up the staircase. As the bar rises, two big paint cans appear taped to it next to the weights. David drops the bar back in its supports, his left arm flops to the floor, but with his right still gripping the bar, he holds himself upright. Joseph comes down the stairs and walks slowly over to David, who twists around to inspect the weights and the paint cans at either end of the bar. David's brow furrows, and Joseph gazes at him in awe. Elijah is lying in a hospital bed and nods almost imperceptibly. Inside, Audrey is sorting through papers on a reception desk as a nurse approaches her and points across the room. Audrey hands the nurse a yellow file, takes another one from her, and walks across the open-plan office. She leans through a doorway and smiles, sitting on a low couch in a treatment room. She looks up at Elijah, who's watching her from his wheelchair, and a metal frame keeps his right leg straight. The street outside the stadium is empty, and inside, along one of the shaded walkways, David, in his security uniform, leans on a wall, casually watching spectators as they crowd in through a gate. He looks away, stares at the ground, and after a moment, pushes himself off the wall, moves to the center of the walkway with his head down and hands in his pockets. The crowd streams past him, laughing and smiling. They jostle and bump him, some almost pushing him aside, but he doesn't react. A large woman in a pink coat, with blonde hair hanging over her shoulders, dragging a small boy by the hand, bangs into him.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: David perches up and places his head on one side quizzically, rotates to observe the weights on the ends of the rod, and Joseph strides up to him. David pivots around to glance at the other extremity of the rod while Joseph observes tensely. Joseph steps several strides back towards an ajar sheltered door. On the bench, David grips his hands out broader than his shoulders and accepts the load, lowers the rod gradually to his chest, and pushes up until his arms are straight. He lowers the rod again and straightens his arms, while Joseph gazes. Finally, David lowers the rod back onto the supports. David's hands wrap around the rod slowly feeling for the optimum grip since even more weights have been clasped to the rod this instance. David frowns slightly, and Joseph stands in the cupboard. On his bench, David braces himself and lowers the rod to his chest. Arms quivering, eyes tightly shut, face distorted, he presses it up to full extension, repeats the press, and returns the rod. Above the rod, Joseph's pale face emerges upside down to David, standing two steps up the staircase. As the rod ascends, two large paint cans appear taped to it next to the weights. David lowers the rod back in its supports, his left arm flops to the floor, but with his right still gripping the rod, he holds himself upright. Joseph descends the stairs and walks slowly over to David, who pivots around to inspect the weights and the paint cans at either end of the rod. David's brow furrows, and Joseph gazes at him in admiration. Elijah is lying in a hospital bed and nods almost imperceptibly. Inside, Audrey is sorting through documents on a reception desk as a nurse approaches her and indicates across the room. Audrey hands the nurse a yellow folder, takes another one from her, and walks across the open-plan office. She leans through a doorway and smiles, sitting on a low couch in a treatment room. She looks up at Elijah, who's watching her from his wheelchair, and a metal framework keeps his right leg straight. The street outside the stadium is vacant, and inside, along one of the shaded walkways, David, in his security attire, leans on a wall, casually watching spectators as they crowd in through a gate. He looks away, stares at the ground, and after a moment, pushes himself off the wall, moves to the center of the walkway with his head down and hands in his pockets. The crowd streams past him, laughing and smiling. They jostle and bump him, some almost pushing him aside, but he doesn't react. A large woman in a pink coat, with blonde hair hanging over her shoulders, dragging a small boy by the hand, bangs into him.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: David is sat up, with his head put quizzically on one side, and the weights on the ends of the bar turned to see by him as Joseph walks up to him. The other end of the bar is looked at by David while Joseph watches tensely. Several paces are taken by Joseph back towards an open covered door. On the bench, David's hands are gripped out wider than his shoulders, and the weight is taken by him, the bar is dropped slowly to his chest, and it is pushed up until his arms are straight. The bar is lowered again and his arms are straightened as Joseph stares. Finally, the bar is dropped back onto the supports by David. David slowly wraps his hands around the bar, feeling for the optimum grip since even more weights have been clamped to it this time. A slight frown is worn by David, and Joseph stands in the cupboard. On his bench, David braces himself and lowers the bar to his chest. His arms quiver, eyes shut tightly, face twisted, and he presses it up to full extension, repeats the press, and replaces the bar. Above the bar, Joseph's white face appears upside down to David, standing two steps up the staircase. As the bar rises, two big paint cans are taped to it next to the weights. The bar is dropped back in its supports by David, his left arm flops to the floor, but the bar is still gripped by his right, and he holds himself upright. The stairs are descended by Joseph who walks slowly over to David, who twists around to inspect the weights and the paint cans at either end of the bar. David's brow furrows him, and he is gazed at in awe by Joseph. Elijah, lying in a hospital bed, nods almost imperceptibly. Inside, Audrey sorts through papers on a reception desk as a nurse approaches her and points across the room. The nurse is handed a yellow file by Audrey, who takes another one from her, and she walks across the open-plan office. A doorway is leaned through by her, and she smiles, sitting on a low couch in a treatment room. Up at Elijah, in his wheelchair watching her, she looks, and a metal frame keeps his right leg straight. The street outside the stadium is empty, and inside, along one of the shaded walkways, David, in his security uniform, leans on a wall, and spectators are casually watched by him as they crowd in through a gate. He looks away, the ground is stared at by him, and after a moment, he pushes himself off the wall, moving to the center of the walkway with his head down and hands in his pockets. The crowd streams past him, laughing and smiling. He is jostled and bumped by them, some almost pushing him aside, but no reaction comes from him. A large woman in a pink coat, with blonde hair hanging over her shoulders, dragging a small boy by the hand, bangs into him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: David sits up, head tilted curiously, and looks at the weights on the bar. Joseph walks over, watching tensely as David examines the other end of the bar. Joseph steps back towards an open door. On the bench, David grips the bar wider than his shoulders, lowers it to his chest, and presses it up. He repeats this while Joseph stares. Finally, David rests the bar on its supports. Adjusting his grip for added weights, David frowns while Joseph stands in the cupboard. Bracing himself, David lowers the bar, eyes shut, face strained, presses it to full extension, repeats, then replaces it. Joseph's upside-down face appears from above, standing on the stairs. Tape-secured paint cans flank the bar. David releases the bar, his left arm drops, but he holds on with his right. Joseph descends slowly to David, who inspects the weights and paint cans, furrowing his brow. Joseph gazes in awe. Elijah lies in a hospital bed, nodding faintly. Audrey is sorting papers at the reception when a nurse points across the room. Audrey exchanges files with the nurse, then enters a treatment room and sits on a low couch, smiling at Elijah in his wheelchair, his leg braced. Outside the stadium, David, in a security uniform, leans on a wall, watching crowds enter through the gate. He looks down, moves to the walkway center, hands pocketed. The crowd passes, jostling him. A large woman in a pink coat, leading a boy, bumps into him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: David sits up, tilts his head, and checks the weights on the bar as Joseph nervously watches. Joseph backs toward a door while David adjusts his grip, lowers the bar to his chest, pushes up, and repeats. He frowns as Joseph stands in the cupboard, then braces to repeat the press. Joseph's upside-down face appears as David lifts, revealing taped paint cans next to the weights. David drops the bar, with his left arm flopping but maintains his grip with the right. Joseph approaches as David inspects the weights and paint cans. David frowns, and Joseph watches in awe. Meanwhile, Elijah nods slightly in his hospital bed. Audrey sorts papers at reception, exchanges files with a nurse, and walks across the office to a treatment room, smiling at Elijah in a wheelchair. Outside the stadium, David, in security uniform, leans on a wall, watching spectators enter. He stares at the ground, moves to the walkway center, and the crowd jostles him without reaction. A large woman in pink, dragging a boy, bumps into him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
David, with a curious tilt of his head, sits up and gazes with a questioning look. He turns his attention to examine the substantial weights attached firmly to the ends of the bar. As this scene unfolds, Joseph approaches, making his way toward David. Observing tensely, Joseph watches as David twists around to check out the other end of the bar. Joseph then cautiously steps back, taking several deliberate paces towards a door that stands open but covered. Seated firmly on the bench, David spaces his hands wider than his shoulder width, grips the bar with determination, and begins to take the weight. He carefully lowers the bar to his chest, and with a focused effort, he pushes it upward until his arms reach full extension. Once more, he lowers the bar and repeats the motion, his arms becoming straight, while Joseph continues to stare intently. Eventually, David returns the bar back to its supports with a deliberate motion. 

David wraps his hands slowly around the bar, feeling for the perfect grip since there's an additional set of weights clamped onto it this time. A slight frown crosses David's face, and Joseph stands nearby in the cupboard. Settling back onto his bench, David braces himself, lowers the bar to his chest, and with quivering arms and eyes tightly shut, face contorted, he manages to press it upward to full extension. He repeats this challenging press and then carefully places the bar back onto its supports. Above him, Joseph's pale face comes into view, appearing upside down to David as he stands two steps up the staircase. As the bar ascends, two large paint cans, conspicuously taped to it next to the weights, come into view. David releases the bar back onto its supports, and though his left arm flops lifelessly to the floor, he maintains an upright posture with his right hand still gripping the bar. Joseph then descends the stairs, proceeding slowly over to where David is stationed. David, twisting around, inspects the weights and paint cans affixed to either end of the bar. His brow furrows in concentration, and Joseph gazes at him with evident awe.

Meanwhile, Elijah lies reclined in a hospital bed, nodding ever so slightly, almost imperceptibly. Inside the hospital, Audrey sifts through a stack of papers at the reception desk. A nurse approaches her, pointing across the room with clear intent. Audrey hands over a yellow file to the nurse, receives another one in exchange, and then walks across the spacious, open-plan office. She leans through a doorway, offering a warm smile as she settles onto a low couch in a treatment room, looking up at Elijah. Elijah watches her from his wheelchair, a metal frame holding his right leg firmly in place. 

Outside the stadium, the street remains conspicuously empty. Inside, along one of the shaded walkways, David, dressed in his official security uniform, casually leans against a wall, his eyes surveying the spectators as they crowd in through a gate. After a brief moment, he glances away, eyes fixed down on the ground. With a sense of resolve, he pushes himself off the wall, moving toward the center of the walkway with his head down, hands resting in his pockets. The bustling crowd streams past him, full of laughter and smiles. They jostle and bump against him, some coming close to pushing him aside, yet he remains unmoved and unresponsive. A large woman, clad in a pink coat, with blonde hair cascading over her shoulders, leads a small boy by the hand. She inadvertently bangs into him, barely acknowledging their brief collision.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
David, with a curious and inquisitive tilt of his head, sits upright in his seat and gazes forward with a questioning and somewhat skeptical look in his eyes. He turns his attention to closely examine and study the substantial weights that are securely attached and firmly fastened to the ends of the sturdy bar. As this scene unfolds with a sense of anticipation, Joseph approaches, making his way toward David in a steady manner. Observing the situation tensely, Joseph watches intently as David twists around to check out and assess the other end of the bar. Joseph then cautiously steps back, taking several deliberate and measured paces toward a door that stands ajar yet remains covered. Seated firmly and securely on the bench, David spaces his hands wider than his shoulder width, grips the bar with determination and focus, and begins to take on the weight. He carefully and gradually lowers the bar to rest on his chest, and with a focused effort, he pushes it upward until his arms reach a full, extended position. Once more, he lowers the bar and repeats the motion, his arms becoming straight once again, while Joseph continues to stare intently with unwavering attention. Eventually, David returns the bar back to its supports with a deliberate and controlled motion.

David wraps his hands slowly and methodically around the bar, feeling for the perfect grip, especially since there’s an additional set of weights clamped onto it this time. A slight frown crosses David's face, and Joseph stands nearby within the cupboard. Settling back onto his sturdy bench, David braces himself, lowers the bar to his chest, and with quivering arms and eyes tightly shut, face contorted in concentration, he manages to press it upward to full extension once more. He repeats this challenging press and then carefully places the bar back onto its supports with precision. Above him, Joseph's pale face comes into view, appearing upside down to David as he stands two steps up the staircase. As the bar ascends, two large paint cans, conspicuously taped to it next to the weights, come into view. David releases the bar back onto its supports, and though his left arm flops lifelessly to the floor, he maintains an upright and composed posture with his right hand still gripping the bar. Joseph then descends the stairs, proceeding slowly and cautiously over to where David is stationed. David, twisting around, inspects the weights and paint cans that are firmly affixed to either end of the bar. His brow furrows in concentration, and Joseph gazes at him with evident and clear awe.

Meanwhile, Elijah lies reclined in a hospital bed, nodding ever so slightly—almost imperceptibly. Inside the hospital, Audrey sifts through a stack of papers at the reception desk with focused attention. A nurse approaches her, pointing across the room with clear intent. Audrey hands over a yellow file to the nurse, receives another one in exchange, and then walks across the spacious and open-plan office. She leans through a doorway, offering a warm and friendly smile as she settles herself onto a low couch in a treatment room, looking up at Elijah. Elijah watches her from his wheelchair, a metal frame holding his right leg firmly and securely in place.

Outside the stadium, the street remains conspicuously and noticeably empty. Inside, along one of the shaded walkways, David, dressed in his official security uniform, casually leans against a wall, his eyes surveying the spectators as they crowd in through a gate. After a brief moment, he glances away, his eyes fixed down on the ground. With a sense of resolve, he pushes himself off the wall, moving toward the center of the walkway with his head slightly down, hands resting comfortably in his pockets. The bustling crowd streams past him, full of laughter and smiles. They jostle and bump against him, some coming close to pushing him aside, yet he remains unmoved and unresponsive. A large woman, clad in a pink coat, with her blonde hair cascading over her shoulders, leads a small boy by the hand. She inadvertently bangs into him, barely acknowledging their brief and unintentional collision.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: David, perched on the bench, begins by lifting his torso upright and tilting his head to one side with a quizzical expression on his face. As he turns, his gaze falls upon the weights clamped onto the ends of the barbell. Simultaneously, Joseph strides towards him, observing with a tense composure. David shifts his body, twisting around to glance at the opposite end of the bar, all while Joseph maintains his watchful stance. Joseph then retreats a few steps towards an open door that is covered, perhaps for privacy or protection. Back on the bench, David widens his grip on the bar so that his hands are positioned wider than the span of his shoulders and then proceeds to lift the weight. With controlled movement, he lowers the bar gingerly to his chest and subsequently pushes it back up with strength until his arms extend straight. Maintaining focus, he repeats the action of lowering the bar and extends his arms once more, all under Joseph’s steady gaze. Eventually, David guides the bar back onto the supports. Taking a moment to recalibrate, David cautiously wraps his hands around the bar again, this time feeling for the optimal grip, noting that additional weights have been attached. With a slight frown furrowing his brow, he braces himself on the bench, clearly aware of the increased challenge. As David steadily lowers the bar to his chest, his arms quiver, his eyes squeeze shut, and his face contorts with effort. He presses the bar back up to full extension, repeats the pressing motion, and deftly replaces the bar onto the supports. Above the bar, Joseph’s pale face appears upside down from David’s perspective, standing two steps up the staircase. Upon raising the bar, David notices two large paint cans taped next to the weights on either end. Exhausted, he drops the bar back onto its supports, and his left arm flops to the floor while his right hand continues to grip the bar, holding himself upright. Joseph descends the stairs with deliberate slowness and approaches David, who twists around to scrutinize the weights and the attached paint cans at both ends of the bar, his brow creased with concentration. Joseph looks on in awe at the spectacle of David’s exertion. Meanwhile, in the quiet of a hospital room, Elijah lies motionless in bed, nodding almost imperceptibly. Elsewhere, inside a bustling reception area, Audrey sorts through a pile of papers at the desk as a nurse approaches and directs her attention across the room. In response, Audrey hands the nurse a yellow file, accepts another one in exchange, and proceeds to traverse the open-plan office. She leans through a doorway and greets the room with a warm smile, eventually settling onto a low couch in a treatment room. Her gaze lifts towards Elijah, who observes her from his wheelchair, his right leg immobilized by a metal frame. Outside, the street near the stadium lies empty, presenting a stark contrast to the hustle within. Inside the shaded walkways, David, clad in his security uniform, casually leans against a wall, his eyes tracking the throng of spectators as they funnel through a gate. After a moment of contemplation, he averts his gaze to the ground and, with a slight push off the wall, he moves to the center of the walkway, head down and hands resting in his pockets. The crowd, lively and cheerful, flows around him, occasionally jostling him, but he remains unreactive. Among them, a large woman wearing a vibrant pink coat, her blonde hair cascading over her shoulders, tugs a small boy along by hand and unintentionally collides with David.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: David sits up, glancing at the bar's weights, as Joseph approaches and then steps back toward an open door. Assuming a wide grip on the bench, David lifts the bar, executes a steady press, and returns the bar to its supports while Joseph watches tensely. With increased weights now on the bar, David readjusts his grip, frowning slightly, as Joseph stands nearby. David braces himself for another lift, pressing the bar to full extension despite quivering arms and a twisted expression. After replacing the bar, Joseph appears above him on the stairs. David notices paint cans taped to the weights as he again drops the bar, his left arm dropping to the floor. Joseph descends the stairs and approaches David, who inspects the weights, furrowing his brow while Joseph gazes admiringly. Meanwhile, Elijah, in a hospital bed, gives a subtle nod. Inside, Audrey, sorting papers at a reception desk, exchanges files with a nurse and moves to a treatment room, smiling at Elijah in his wheelchair. Outside the stadium, David, in his security uniform, leans on a wall, observing the incoming spectators. He looks down, then steps into the walkway's center with hands in pockets. The crowd jostles past him, indifferent to his presence, until a large woman in a pink coat, dragging a small boy, bumps into him.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: David, a regular at the local gym that once hosted a regional weightlifting competition, sits up and puts his head on one side quizzically, turns to see the weights on the ends of the bar, and Joseph, his long-time workout partner and coach, walks up to him. David twists around to look at the other end of the bar while Joseph, who trained with David during his college athletic days, watches tensely. Joseph takes several paces back towards an open covered door that leads to the equipment storage room. On the bench, David grips his hands out wider than his shoulders, as recommended by professional weightlifting guidelines, and takes the weight, drops the bar slowly to his chest, and pushes up until his arms are straight. He lowers the bar again and straightens his arms, while Joseph stares, assessing his form. Finally, David drops the bar back onto the supports designed to hold substantial weights. David's hands wrap around the bar slowly feeling for the optimum grip since even more weights have been clamped to the bar this time, reflecting his incremental progress over weeks of training. David is frowning slightly, and Joseph stands in the cupboard where extra weights are stored. On his bench, David braces himself and lowers the bar to his chest. Arms quivering, eyes tight shut, face twisted, he presses it up to full extension, repeats the press, and replaces the bar. Above the bar, Joseph's white face appears upside down to David, standing two steps up the staircase that leads to the gym's viewing area. As the bar rises, two big paint cans, repurposed as makeshift weights, appear taped to it next to the standard weights. David drops the bar back in its supports, his left arm flops to the floor, but with his right still gripping the bar, he holds himself upright. Joseph comes down the stairs and walks slowly over to David, who twists around to inspect the weights and the paint cans at either end of the bar. David's brow furrows, considering the unconventional balance, and Joseph gazes at him in awe, knowing David's determination has been unmatched since his first competition. Elijah is lying in a hospital bed in the general ward, nods almost imperceptibly, aware of the environment around him. Inside, Audrey, who works as an administrative assistant at the hospital, is sorting through papers on a reception desk as a nurse approaches her and points across the room towards the outpatient area. Audrey hands the nurse a yellow file, a standard practice for transferring patient information, takes another one from her, and walks across the open-plan office. She leans through a doorway and smiles, sitting on a low couch in a treatment room designed for patient consultations. She looks up at Elijah, who's watching her from his wheelchair, and a metal frame, typical for stabilizing fractures, keeps his right leg straight. The street outside the stadium is empty, and inside, along one of the shaded walkways, David, in his security uniform for the stadium, leans on a wall, casually watching spectators as they crowd in through a gate for an evening sports event. He looks away, stares at the ground, and after a moment, pushes himself off the wall, moves to the center of the walkway with his head down and hands in his pockets. The crowd streams past him, laughing and smiling, the buzz of anticipation palpable. They jostle and bump him, some almost pushing him aside, but he doesn't react, maintaining his professional composure. A large woman in a pink coat, with blonde hair hanging over her shoulders, dragging a small boy by the hand who is eagerly pointing at the stadium posters, bangs into him.

David twists around to look at the other end of the bar while Joseph watches tensely. Joseph takes several paces back towards an open covered door. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Joseph comes down the stairs and walks slowly over to David who twists around to inspect the weights and the paint cans at either end of the bar. David's brow furrows and Joseph gazes at him in awe. Elijah is lying in a hospital bed and nods almost imperceptibly. Inside. Audrey is sorting through papers on a reception desk as a nurse approaches her and points across the room. Audrey hands the nurse a yellow file takes another one from her and walks across the openplan office. She leans through a doorway and smiles sitting on a low couch in a treatment room. She looks up at Elijah who is watching her from his wheelchair and a metal frame keeps his right leg straight. The street outside the stadium is empty and inside along one of the shaded walkways. David in his security uniform leans on a wall casually watching spectators as they crowd in through a gate. He looks away stares at the ground and after a moment pushes himself off the wall moves to the center of the walkway with his head down and hands in his pockets. The crowd streams past him laughing and smiling. They jostle and bump him some almost pushing him aside but he does not react. A large woman in a pink coat with blonde hair hanging over her shoulders dragging. a small boy by the hand bangs into him.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Joseph comes down the stairs and walks slowly over to David who twists around to inspect the weights and the paint cans at either end of the bar. David's brow furrows and Joseph gazes at him in awe. Elijah is lying in a hospital bed and nods almost imperceptibly. Inside. Audrey is sorting through papers on a reception desk as a nurse approaches her and points across the room. Audrey hands the nurse a yellow file takes another one from her and walks across the openplan office. She leans through a doorway and smiles sitting on a low couch in a treatment room. She looks up at Elijah who is watching her from his wheelchair and a metal frame keeps his right leg straight. The street outside the stadium is empty and inside along one of the shaded walkways. David in his security uniform leans on a wall casually watching spectators as they crowd in through a gate. He looks away stares at the ground and after a moment pushes himself off the wall moves to the center of the walkway with his head down and hands in his pockets. The crowd streams past him laughing and smiling. They jostle and bump him some almost pushing him aside but he does not react. A large woman in a pink coat with blonde hair hanging over her shoulders dragging. a small boy by the hand bangs into him.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: David sits up and puts his head on one side quizzically turns to see the weights on the ends of the bar and Joseph walks up to him. David twists around to look at the other end of the bar while Joseph watches tensely. Joseph takes several paces back towards an open covered door. On the bench David grips his hands out wider than his shoulders and takes the weight drops the bar slowly to his chest and pushes up until his arms are straight. He lowers the bar again and straightens his arms while Joseph stares. Finally David drops the bar back onto the supports. David's hands wrap around the bar slowly feeling for the optimum grip since even more weights have been clamped to the bar this time. She looks up at Elijah who is watching her from his wheelchair and a metal frame keeps his right leg straight. The street outside the stadium is empty and inside along one of the shaded walkways. David in his security uniform leans on a wall casually watching spectators as they crowd in through a gate. He looks away stares at the ground and after a moment pushes himself off the wall moves to the center of the walkway with his head down and hands in his pockets. The crowd streams past him laughing and smiling. They jostle and bump him some almost pushing him aside but he does not react. A large woman in a pink coat with blonde hair hanging over her shoulders dragging. a small boy by the hand bangs into him.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: David sits up and puts his head on one side quizzically turns to see the weights on the ends of the bar and Joseph walks up to him. David twists around to look at the other end of the bar while Joseph watches tensely. Joseph takes several paces back towards an open covered door. They jostle and bump him some almost pushing him aside but he does not react. A large woman in a pink coat with blonde hair hanging over her shoulders dragging. a small boy by the hand bangs into him.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Oliver perches down and places his nose to one side curiously, spins to observe the keys on the edges of the table, and Rebecca strolls over to him. Oliver swivels around to peer at the opposite edge of the table while Rebecca watches nervously. Rebecca takes numerous hops backward towards a closed glass cabinet. On the couch, Oliver spreads his wings out wider than his elbows and seizes the feather, nudges the table gently to his beak, and pulls down until his legs are bent. He raises the table again and bends his legs, while Rebecca gapes. Finally, Oliver nudges the table back onto the pegs. Oliver's wings clutch the table gently, searching for the best hold since even more feathers have been glued to the table this round. Oliver is frowning slightly, and Rebecca dwells in the wardrobe. On his couch, Oliver steadies himself and nudges the table to his beak. Legs trembling, eyes tightly closed, face scrunched, he hoists it up to full stretch, repeats the hoist, and relocates the table. Below the table, Rebecca's red hat emerges sideways to Oliver, standing three hops up the ladder. As the table descends, two large books appear pinned to it beside the feathers. Oliver nudges the table back in its pegs, his left wing flops to the floor, but with his right still holding the table, he steadies himself upright. Rebecca descends the ladder and strolls slowly over to Oliver, who swivels around to examine the feathers and the books at either edge of the table. Oliver's eyes narrow, and Rebecca peers at him in astonishment. Noah is resting in a lounge chair and winks almost unnoticeably. Inside, Helen is sifting through documents on a front desk as a doctor approaches her and gestures across the corridor. Helen passes the doctor a blue folder, accepts another one from the doctor, and strolls across the open-plan hallway. She peeks through a doorway and grins, reclining on a high stool in an examination room. She glances up at Noah, who's observing her from his rocking chair, and a wooden brace keeps his left arm straight. The garden outside the arena is deserted, and inside, along one of the dim paths, Oliver, in his waiter outfit, reclines on a pillar, nonchalantly observing visitors as they pour in through a turnstile. He glances elsewhere, gazes at the ceiling, and after a moment, propels himself off the pillar, saunters to the center of the path with his head lowered and hands on his hips. The visitors flow past him, giggling and chuckling. They shove and nudge him, some nearly displacing him, but he remains still. A tall man in a green jacket, with black hair draping over his ears, tugging a big girl by the arm, collides with him.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: David, on a bench press, tests his strength with increasing weights as Joseph watches tensely. As David pushes the bar with paint cans attached, he struggles, but manages a full extension before resting. Joseph appears in awe of David's efforts. Meanwhile, Elijah lies in a hospital bed, and Audrey, sorting papers at a reception desk, interacts with a nurse before entering a treatment room where Elijah observes her from a wheelchair. Outside a stadium, David, in his security uniform, idly leans against a wall, observing the entering crowd. Despite being jostled by passersby, he remains unfazed, maintaining a detached demeanor.
